channel.title: Docs on Yuzhen Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Docs on Yuzhen Blog

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—3. Deploying with GitHub Pages
item.description: We aim to host the static website generated by Hugo using GitHub Pages service, which allows us to avoid maintaining our own server and ensures more stability and security. Therefore, we need to upload the static web files generated by Hugo to the GitHub Pages repository.

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—2. Customizing the Blowfish Theme
item.description: 1. Site Configuration # After copying the exampleSite folder, the site directory structure becomes as follows: my-site/ ├── archetypes/ │ └── default.md ├── assets/

item.title: Build a Personal Blog—1. Install Hugo, Git, Configure the Blowfish Theme
item.description: Why Rebuild # Recently, I’ve been preparing for the AWS SAA exam and learning new technologies through side projects. I want to document this journey. Since all the previous blog files were on an old computer in China and the GitHub repository only had public content, I decided to restart my blog as a way to practice writing and keep records.
